title: Luxury Travel Consumers Willing to Pay to Experience Local Flavor
text:
Luxury Travel Consumers Willing to Pay to Experience Local Flavor By Jill Malandrino | 07/25/15 - 02:15 PM EDT Reprint 
NEW YORK ( TheStreet ) -- In 2014, the total economic contribution to travel and leisure for the global economy was $7.58 trillion, according to Statista.com . 
Shifts in the economy, new technology, and contemporary parenting have had a measurable impact on the rapid and sustained growth of this travel segment, specifically how it is packaged, planned and paid for. 
Luxury travel trends continue to evolve in this on-demand economy we are living in. Inspirato is a luxury vacation club with over 10,000 members. 
Essentially the company manages and controls 300 global luxury destinations, David Kallery of Inspirato tells TheStreet's Jill Malandrino that the key is the level of service from the concierge team that separates the company from other destination competitors.

In fact, American Express ( AXP - Get Report ) partnered with Inspirato. 
Kallery says the top luxury destinations include Tuscany, Italy, Mexico, Hawaii and the summer always draws the luxury consumer to Nantucket , Mass., and Sea Island, Ga. 
Inspirato is competitive with the likes of Airbnb , VRBO or any of the listing sites in the curation of the homes. 
In fact, Inspirato will put another $50,000 to $75,000 of upgrades into the homes in the portfolio and the homes will never be found on a listing site as the homes and level of service fits the curation model. 
Kallery explains even luxury travel customers seek value too. Leasing vacation properties (rather than owning), keeps membership fees lower than traditional destination clubs. 
Even in this on-demand environment, Kallery says there is still plenty of growth in the luxury travel industry . Areas of focus include the West Coast in the U.S., Hawaii and the Caribbean.
